string-array.name: selection_setup_attendee
string-array.item: Yes, I\'ll be attending from San Francisco.
No, I\'ll be viewing from home or attending a Google I/O Extended event.

string-array.name: selection_setup_wifi
string-array.item: Yes, add the conference Wi-Fi network now.
No thanks, I\'ll connect on my own.

resources.string:
Google I/O 2013
Version %s

Terms of Service

Privacy Policy
All office hours at Google I/O 2013.
All developer sandbox companies at Google I/O 2013.
An application requires Google Play Services to be enabled.
An application requires installation of Google Play Services.
An application requires an update for Google Play Services.
An application attempted to use a bad version of Google Play Services.
This app won\'t work unless you enable Google Play services.
This app won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your phone.
This app won\'t run without Google Play services, which are missing from your tablet.
The specified account does not exist on this device. Please choose a different account.
A data connection is required to connect to Google Play services.
Unknown issue with Google Play services.
Google Play services, which some of your applications rely on, is not supported by your device. Please contact the manufacturer for assistance.
This app won\'t run unless you update Google Play services.
Displays the next few items in your Google I/O 2013 schedule.
Choose an account below. If you registered to attend Google I/O, make sure to use the same account.
If not, we\'ll only show live-streamed sessions. You can always change this in Settings.
Are you attending Google I/O in person this year?

Since you\'re attending in person, we can set up this device to access the conference Wi-Fi network. By configuring your Wi-Fi now, you\'ll help prevent network congestion.

Note: If your device only supports 2.4 GHz networks, you\'ll need to manually connect upon arrival.
Configure Wi-Fi access on this device?

Welcome to the Google I/O 2013 app, your official companion to the Google I/O conference taking place in San Francisco from May 15th to May 17th, 2013.

We just need to ask you a couple of quick questions. Press the "Sign-in" button to get started.
No Google accounts are available. Add an account to continue.
No captions found for this session.
No more upcoming sessions.\nSee you next year!
Touch the Google I/O 2013 logo above to sign in and begin using the app.

By downloading, installing or using this application or any portion thereof (\"Application\"), you agree to these terms and conditions.

Your use of this Application is governed by: (a) the Google Terms of Service (m.google.com/utos); (b) Google\'s Privacy Policy (http://www.google.com/policies/privacy); and (c) any applicable Google Service-specific terms of service or privacy policies. Google\'s terms of service and privacy policies may be updated from time to time and without notice.

This Application collects certain information as you use it, including via Google Analytics. Google\'s Privacy Policy explains how Google treats your information and protects your privacy when you use the Application. You agree to the use of your data in accordance with Google\'s privacy policy.
Can\'t sign in. Check your network connection.
When checked, all sessions and on-site events will be shown. Otherwise, only live-streamed sessions will be shown.
When checked, show local times instead of Pacific time (the timezone at the conference)
Will you use the technology featured in this section in the next 6 months?
How relevant was this session to your coding projects?
Sorry, there was an error initializing the YouTube Player (%1$s)
Sorry, there was an error loading the live stream, please try again later

Google I/O\'s much-anticipated kickoff event will make you among the first developers to see what we\'ve been working on here at Google. Grab some popcorn, kick back and enjoy the show directly from your Android powered device.
Sorry, unable to update WiFi configuration
